com.yantra.api.omp.receipts

Interface changeReceiptStatus

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface changeReceiptStatus

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document changeReceiptStatus(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      changeReceiptStatus is used to change receipt status.

    • Method Detail

      • changeReceiptStatus

        org.w3c.dom.Document changeReceiptStatus(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        changeReceiptStatus is used to change receipt status. This API can be configured as a transaction (derived from an abstract transaction) that works off the task queue. You may define multiple pickup statuses and one drop status for each transaction. Drop status has to be an extension of pickup status.

          The processing logic of the API is as follows:
        1. Carry out input validations as detailed under the Validations section.
        2. Determine the drop status for the receipt based on the receipt's pipeline and transaction.
        3. Call register process completion to close the task queue request (if API called with TaskQKey as input).
        4. Create new tasks for the (next) transactions in the pipeline that pick up the receipt from the dropped status (if required).
        5. Update the receipt status as determined in step 2 and write receipt status change audit.

        Validations:
        /Receipt
        • If TaskQKey is passed in the input XML, then it is used to read the receipt that needs a status change.
        • If TaskQKey is not passed, ReceiptNo, ReceivingNode, ShipmentKey or ReceiptHeaderKey must be passed.
        • TransactionId needs to be passed only if TaskQKey is not passed.
        • If TaskQKey is passed, the TransactionId provided in the inputXML will be ignored. TransactionId is then derived based on the TaskQKey.
        • TransactionId being used needs to be an instance of the abstract transaction CHANGE_RECEIPT_STATUS
        • BaseDropStatus passed is used to determine the actual drop status that the transaction would drop the receipt to.
        • If BaseDropStatus is not passed, then the transaction must have only one base status defined as a part of the setup.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None.

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction CHANGE_RECEIPT_STATUS.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of changeReceiptStatus.
            Data published - YFS_CHANGE_RECEIPT_STATUS.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - receipt_dbd.txt
            The XML depicted above represent the output that the abstract transaction CHANGE_RECEIPT_STATUS is capable of generating.

        Audits:
        If this node <ReceiptStatusAudit> is not passed in the input, then YFS_RECEIPT_STATUS_AUDIT record is written indicating the from and to status change along with date for the change accomplished. If the node is passed with values for reason code, reason text, status date, these will be used to fill the appropriate fields ( StatusDate attribute used for new_status_date field in YFS_RECEIPT_STATUS_AUDIT table and also status_date field in YFS_RECEIPT table )

        Pre Conditions: None.

        Post Conditions:
        Receipt status is changed and the status change audit written.

        Output Template Support: Yes.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the receipt. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
